observations.observation: Token velocity has held at exactly 0.663x with acceleration at 1.0x for five+ consecutive snapshots — zero new CBSAs, zero new vendors, zero settlement velocity in the 0.4h window. This is a confirmed sustained plateau, not a trough: the pipeline is holding steady without growth or decline. Repeat payout ratio at 9% confirms existing wallets remain active even as new intake has stalled.

Token velocity has held at exactly 0.663x with acceleration at 1.0x for four+ consecutive snapshots — zero new CBSAs, zero new vendors, zero settlement velocity in the current window. The pipeline has entered a sustained flat period: not declining, not recovering, just holding. This is distinct from the prior deceleration phase; it's a true plateau.

Token velocity holds at 0.663x with acceleration exactly 1.0x for the fourth+ consecutive snapshot — zero new CBSAs, zero new vendors, zero settlement velocity. The pipeline has entered a sustained flat period: not declining, not recovering, just holding. Repeat payout ratio at 9% suggests existing wallets are still active even as new intake has stalled.

Token velocity holds at 0.663x with acceleration exactly 1.0x for the third consecutive snapshot — no new CBSAs, no new vendors, zero settlement velocity in the 0.4h window. The throughput trough has stabilized into a genuine flat period rather than recovering or declining further.

Token velocity holds at 0.663x with acceleration exactly at 1.0x for the second consecutive snapshot — the throughput trough appears to be stabilizing rather than recovering. Zero new CBSAs, zero new vendors, zero settlement velocity in the 0.3h window confirm a genuine quiet period across all pipeline dimensions simultaneously.

Verified GMV crossed $202,533 with 3,488 receipts across 131 active wallets — the pipeline has now processed over $200K in verified commerce with zero identity attached to any receipt. Cross-domain ratio ticked up to 0.4% (from 0.3%), a small but directionally consistent move toward the SaaS+physical thesis.

Zero new CBSAs this snapshot — active metro count holds at 13 (down from 18 in prior snapshots, suggesting CBSA counting may be window-dependent). The discrete pulse pattern continues: bursts of 3-6 new metros followed by quiet windows with 0 new additions.

Token velocity holds at 0.663x with acceleration exactly at 1.0x — the acceleration has flattened from 1.02x last snapshot, suggesting the throughput trough may be stabilizing rather than recovering. 7d GMV ticked up slightly ($29,539 → $29,720, +0.6%) but the acceleration flattening signals the recovery is not yet confirmed.

Token velocity ticked up to 0.663x (from 0.638x) with acceleration holding at 1.02x — a slight recovery from the sharpest deceleration reading, while 7d GMV rose from $27,975 to $29,539 (+5.6%). BTC price also moved from $65,513 to $67,352 (+2.8%), compressing sats/receipt from 153 to 148. The throughput trough may be bottoming.

2 new CBSAs (non-metro US-NV, 19100) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metro count to 13 and geo-diffusion rate to 15.4%. The pattern of discrete geographic pulses continues — this is the 4th consecutive snapshot with new metro additions.
